text: Joseph Guy (30 July 1813 – 15 April 1873) was an English professional cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1837 to 1854. A right-handed batsman and occasional wicket-keeper who was mainly associated with Nottinghamshire, he made 149 known appearances in first-class matches.CricketArchive. Retrieved on 2 December 2008. He represented the Players in the Gentlemen v Players series and was an original member of William Clarke's All-England Eleven. He also played for Hampshire. Guy was a great stylist as a batsman and Clarke said of him: "Elegance, all elegance, fit to play before the Queen in her parlour."Harry Altham (1962) A History of Cricket, Volume 1 (to 1914), George Allen & Unwin, p. 85. Guy scored 3395 runs in his first-class career at 13.41 with a top score of 98 from eight half- centuries. He took 102 catches and completed 14 stumpings. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1813 births Category:1873 deaths Category:English cricketers Category:English cricketers of 1826 to 1863 Category:All-England Eleven cricketers Category:Hampshire cricketers Category:Nottinghamshire cricketers Category:North v South cricketers Category:Players cricketers Category:Sportspeople from Nottingham Category:Midland Counties cricketers Category:Nottingham Cricket Club cricketers Category:Players of Nottinghamshire cricketers Category:Gentlemen of Southwell cricketers Category:Fast v Slow cricketers Category:Nicholas Felix's XI cricketers Category:Married v Single cricketers Category:Over 36 v Under 36 cricketers
title: Joe Guy (cricketer)
